intro: Gutierrezia longipappa, commonly known as desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers range from yellow to orange, attracting various pollinators. Gutierrezia longipappa plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
